Boosts should not be considered endorsements (although some of them may be cool!)

I like trains.

This is the official Mastodon account for Democrats Abroad, the Democratic Party arm for the millions of Americans living outside the US. We strive to provide Americans abroad with a Democratic voice in our government and to elect Democratic candidates by mobilizing the overseas vote.

If you're a US citizen who lives abroad, YOU CAN VOTE in the upcoming #2024Election.

To register, or get overseas voting information for your state, go to http://VoteFromAbroad.org.

We post daily.

note: Time for a proper introduction. I am a literature teacher, mostly retired. I love reading, music, baking, nature & cats. I am learning to boost a lot, which includes my passion for a truly inclusive world, so lots of support for Black, Indigenous, LGBTQIA+, Women, Working Class, & other rights. I understand users who want Mastodon to be a quiet corner, but I am more concerned about what happens if we look the other way when people suffer.

Not-for-profit project dedicated to exploring curious and compelling works from the history of art, literature, and ideas — focusing on works now fallen into the public domain.

Here we'll mostly be tooting about content on our site. 🎺

note:
Marie Skłodowska-Curie Actions Fellow at the Universität Leipzig researching the use of East German films as cultural diplomacy at film festivals in the West.

Often found in archives, cinemas, and second-hand bookshops.

I write about German cinema, in particular East German film, the Holocaust on film, and historical films.

I have a particular interest in inclusive teaching practices.
